sentence.Network_en: There are some wonderful trumpet and trombone solos in the piece.
sentence.Network_cn: 这支乐曲中有一些美妙的小号和长号的独奏.

sentence.Network_en: Every time I sing that line, I have to compete with that bloody trombone!
sentence.Network_cn: 每次唱到那一句，我都不得不跟那该死的长号拼声音。

sentence.Network_en: My friend Greta plays the trombone in the school band.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的朋友Greta在乐队在吹长号.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from French or Italian, from Italian tromba 'trumpet'

entry.def: A trombone is a large musical instrument of the brass family. It consists of two long oval tubes, one of which can be pushed backwards and forwards to play different notes.

means.word_mean: 1. a brass instrument consisting of a long tube whose length can be varied by a U-shaped slide
